$block: The TransportWebhook resource is a collection of transports that carry dispatched alerts to any external webhook destination.

$ul: **createdAt**: When the resource instance was created. This date-time is in the UTC timezone.
**dataSegmentCode**: User-provided string on which to segment and filter data. Max 50 characters.
**httpMethodCode**: The HTTP request method that must be used.
**id**: The unique identifier of the resource instance.

**mustBeEncryptedValue**: An optional and arbitrary secret value that must be stored in encrypted format, such as an access token. In the webhookUrl and/or webhookHeaders fields, use the special ENCRYPTED_VALUE placeholder (must be uppercase), which we will replace with the decrypted secret value when using the transport.
**partition**: The partition that contains this resource instance. The resource cannot be moved to another partition.
**resourceOwner**: The name of the person who owns this resource.
**webhookHeaders**: The HTTP request headers, if any, for the Webhook service. To use the encrypted value:  E.g., Authorization: Bearer ENCRYPTED_VALUE.
**webhookUrl**: The URL for the Webhook service.
